content: all right this may be one of my top 5 favorite projects that I've ever done
we're going to build what is similar to and inspired by it but definitely not
the same as and Eldar Falcon you
okay so there's a link in the
description of this video below with some templates in it use the bigger one
and trace and cut out a piece of single corrugated cardboard and then apply
corrugation cladding when we take our 1 inch thick
polystyrene also known as insulation available at your local home improvement
store and cut out a block that is 10 centimeters by 5 centimeters then cut a
45 degree taper at both short end like you see here and them on the front inch
just chop off a bit making a small flat area like this hot glue this block to
the main body so that the front face is flushed with the inner edge like this
then take some fine grit sandpaper and round off the edges in hindsight I wish
I had done this before attaching it would have been easier here's some
wooden spools so just some random bits from the crafting store glue two of them
together and then attach to the side of the foam block set pretty far back most
of it should be hanging off of the main body attach another one to the other
side as well now use the other template and cut out some cereal box cardstock
dry-fit it so that it covers both engines hot glue the centre down first
making sure that it's centered and straight and then with a thin bead of
hot glue attach each end to the main body
prepare another foam block this one five centimeters long by four centimeters
wide cut two tapers along the short sides one that's very steep and one
that's very shallow both meet at a point at the top smooth the edges with
sandpaper and hot glue it to the tent set forward basically so the front slope
kind of continues down to the lower block or I know use magnets so that you
can swivel it yes I know now that took some cereal box and just cut strips to
shape and wrap them around the edge of the wings just drawing inspiration from
the source image a bit here same for the canopies there's some panels on there as
well and now the race bones I just free handed these on chipboard
and cut them out since these are really exposed I wanted them to be strong so
cereal box wasn't going to cut it I need my go to chipboard for this any
extremely heavy cardstock will do though
cut some ovals and hot glue them on representing the cockpits so New Year's
happened not too long ago and we had champagne from some cheap disposable
flutes the basses came off of them and so I kept them and wouldn't you know it
they're exactly 60 millimeters in diameter absolutely perfect for a large
flying clear round base in Warhammer 40k so we hot glue the main body to it I
positioned it just based on where it is in the inspirational image let's make
some weapons because this thing is loaded to the nines inject a drinking
straw with hot glue and set it aside for a while to harden then chop some short
segments and hot glue them to some beads which in turn are hot glued to a couple
bits of foam board which is then in turn hot glued to the underside of the main
body just below the lower cockpit these are intended to be linked shotguns
here's a random bead from my collection got a few gemstones in it kind of
exotic-looking kind a hot glue a kebab skewer into it
and chop it down to about two inches whatever feels right then take an empty
drinking straw cut it to half that length inject it with hot glue and while
it's still hot insert the skewer and then maybe at other short lengths of
drinking straw with some small bead on the end attached lengthwise to the main
cannon so this could be some kind of exotic elder weapon I don't know anyway
this assembly also gets hot glued to a bit of foam board which then gets
mounted to the underside and now three pieces of kebab skewer about two inches
long grouped together with superglue so that there's no ugly blobs of hot glue
spilling out wrap one end with paper or very thin cardstock this will reinforce
that triangular shape of the gun barrel and glue the other end to a bit of
polystyrene which is then glued to the side of the upper turret this could be
the shuriken cannon or something like that so I know I didn't do the bright
lamps maybe in the future truth be told that's a really distinctive weapon and I
really want to nail it since I'm doing a race Lord in the near
future I want them both to look identical and I'm simply not done yet
experimenting with what the best way to make it is
since I'm on paint is red I base the thing in white except for the bits that
will be metallic namely the weapons and the engines so then I base it in red now
I'm going to dry brush on progressive shades of orange covering less with each
shade to get a crude gradient i experimented with wet blending but these
paints are too low in quality to get good results so I went with this then
using a toothpick edge highlight all the edges with plain white I'm using two
metallics here for variety classic gunmetal and my new favorite shimmering
silver which you may have noticed I've been using a lot of lately
it's weird some shades even by the same manufacturer are like water and some are
thick and give great one code coverage it's inconsistent this shimmering silver
has been awesome for me so I hit my metallics just be creative here's some
costume jewelry from my random box I'm going to use wire cutters and snip a
portion of the bracelet out and attach it to the turret using some superglue
again I recommend the Loctite gel control super glue and then again
drawing from the inspirational source image I'm going to bejeweled the hell
out of this thing it is an alien craft after all
lastly I prepared some transfers exactly described in episode 9 except that these
are only one-sided and I attach them with plain old glue stick one on the
front one on the back so quite happy with us you know again
this is for home play you wouldn't take this to a tournament or informal but
good enough for counts as there you can see the rough gradient effect hoping to
buy an airbrush soon and an experiment with that but till till then does I'll
have to do really lucked out on the base I wish I could remember the brand but I
don't again champagne glasses disposable ones
and the bottom comes off ya lucked out with this bracelet - I really like that
little piece and here we are we have a mock or and some carnufex --is and some
harm Oh God's coming across a winter field
there's the toxic spills from episode 57 anyway they're coming up on the power
station from episode 59 to a group of Eldar and there's some Rangers up on the
high ground and here is the Falcon so it's an imposing presence on the
battlefield compared to these little guys oh I catch her very fun I am why
lock thanks for joining me and I'll see you next time
